It's now well documented that we are already seeing Russian interference in this election, but this time it is singularly focused on Ukraine (ending aid, convincing politicians receptive to anti-Ukraine messaging). Read, if you haven't already. 

https://t.co/nUYgRRZfH8 https://t.co/7jf8Tw8tBy

An honor guest lecturing @Timothy_Edgar‚Äôs @Harvard Law class today. Impressed with the questions and left feeling (unusually) hopeful for our future. 

Also rare spotting of wild turkeys in Harvard Square. https://t.co/8KX3pBcnic

An incredibly detailed Cyber Safety Review Board report detailing China's 2023 Microsoft Exchange hack which compromised (among hundreds) Commerce Secretary Gina Raimondo, Ambassador Nicholas Burns, and Congressman Bacon. a must-read. https://t.co/hRxPhq2k7Y

It‚Äôs not looking good for Apple in China. For years, PRC handed stolen IP to Huawei. Now the CCP is banning iPhones for state employees and pushing Huawei. Sales of iPhones in China down 24%(!) from last year? 

Watch. This. Space. https://t.co/0HlQQCxrTa

Loved speaking with the pros over at News Items. We talked MADD (mutually assured Digital destruction), election security, zero days, A.I. and it was so fun, we went long. You can listen to our two part podcast here: https://t.co/b5dUwx45Zg
I am absolutely thrilled to announce I‚Äôll be keynoting the @CyberWeekTLV cybersecurity conference in Tel Aviv this June. I hope to see many of you there.

This election is the most tempting for foreign interference than any we've seen (See: Ukraine). 

It's already happening. And nobody on this platform is watching. 

A wake up call from @AletheaInsights and @SangerNYT @julianbarnes https://t.co/nUYgRRYHRA

It begins...  the first known attack on A.I. workloads... a goldmine. In this case, cybercriminals are using AI's massive compute power to mine crypto using a vuln in Ray, a popular opensource platform. Expect more, and worse. Bravo to Oligo for finding it https://t.co/zerngAaXcT
I would love to hear from someone, anyone, whose job it is to test AI models for security weaknesses. And, crucially, has any confidence in their process.
ICYMI: Nothing Scares China More Than a Russian Defeat in Ukraine by @CISAJen https://t.co/CjtYWoxmWQ
Very cool to see. Rotterdam tests quantum network to defend against cyber threats. https://t.co/Hg2waPmmcm

Bono plays tribute to NAVALNY with Neil Finn‚Äôs DON‚ÄôT DREAM IT‚ÄôS OVER tonight at the Sphere on their final show in Vegas. 

NAVALNY lives on. Putin tried to kill him, but only made NAVALNY more powerful. #U2UVSphere https://t.co/BVMGJcnmHg

‚ÄúThe only thing necessary for the triumph of evil is for good people to do nothing.‚Äù

- NAVALNY

üíî

Where is the Nayib Bukele biopic? Incredible turnaround on gang violence in El Salvador. Only candidate to get elected outside the two party system since Duarte. Young. Born to a Palestinian Christian and Greek Orthodox . Swept reelection. https://t.co/17WMaKT7BZ

Knock knock. Anyone still here?

Been awhile since I invested any serious time here and wondering whether it‚Äôs worth it, or has everyone scattered? Threads? Mastodon? Blue sky?

Xi warned Biden during summit that Beijing will reunify Taiwan with China. 

Timing undecided. But imho cyber will play a pivotal role in China‚Äôs strategy to deter US interference. https://t.co/Qnj6y50lb4

How did Hamas fund its 10/7 operation? Crypto, played a part, but makes up only a small piece of a much larger terror financing puzzle. Very good breakdown from the good folks over at @trmlabs   https://t.co/ielCABtuyx
Chinese spies recruited/paid Belgian politician to divide the West for more than 3 years AND WHEN DO TWITTER HEADLINES RETURN?https://t.co/PbFOTkqf8m

üÜò. Breaches by Iran-affiliated hackers spanned multiple U.S. states, federal agencies say.
 https://t.co/18FFzlqDcQ

Now, more than ever, it seems so many of our country‚Äôs ailments would be solved by moving away from party voting to issue voting. The two-party system is holding us hostage to extremists on both sides. What would it take to move to issue voting?
More than 24,000 Chinese citizens have been apprehended crossing into the US from Mexico in the past year. That is more than in the preceding 10 years combined. https://t.co/5Q4Nmxshg5

Ahead of OpenAI CEO Sam Altman‚Äôs ouster several staff researchers wrote a letter to the board of directors warning of a powerful artificial intelligence discovery ****that they said could threaten humanity****

#thisishowtheytemetheworldends  https://t.co/p5XcQCTrcl

Just in time for the release of Biden's new AI Executive Order, @sarahfrier @MitchellBaker and I will be discussing automation and AI (and the security impacts thereof) with @FinancialTimes' @andrewtghill  in just a few minutes.

Join us, free, here: https://t.co/2WX2kxAtki

Just when I thought this site couldn‚Äôt get any worse, I just saw a (obviously false) report claiming Israel, not Hamas, was responsible for the deaths on Oct 7. That was my rock bottom. 

You have enabled antisemitism at mass scale @elonmusk @lindayaX.

I‚Äôm out.

We are now living in a nightmare of misinformation compounded by the fog of war. I am not one who believes regulation solves everything, but the status quo is negligent. In the hours and days ahead, misinformation is going to get people killed. Social media need to be reined in.

In other news today: ‚ÄúXi and Putin hailed each other as ‚Äúold‚Äù and ‚Äúdear‚Äù friends. They took swipes at the United States and depicted themselves as building a ‚Äúfairer, multipolar world.‚Äù And they marveled at their countries‚Äô ‚Äúdeepening‚Äù trust.‚Äù https://t.co/uApfHdw9hD
Six Months Ago NPR Left Twitter‚Ä¶and it‚Äôs traffic dropped‚Ä¶well‚Ä¶basically it didn‚Äôt drop.  https://t.co/2e1jrmNFDB
What a week to remove headlines @lindayaX and break this site. Unusable when people are desperate for on the ground, real-time updates. Shameless.

Smart @tomfriedman Op-Ed worth your time: ‚ÄúIsrael Has Never Needed to Be Smarter Than in This Moment‚Äù

https://t.co/7D4liWZHAP

I haven‚Äôt spent any real time on this site in months but wow‚Ä¶ Elon has rendered it almost completely unusable.

Now is when Trust & Safety teams are especially critical. Instead, we find ourselves in a mis/disinformation abyss.

üÜò

I've been fortunate to hear from many strangers here who had my dad as a teacher, doctor, or colleague. I've shared your remembrances with him over the years and am heartbroken to now tell you that my dad, that legend and lion, the smartest (and humblest) man I know has passed.ü©∂ https://t.co/n7xnqgXJ7F

Can some enterprising reporter (not on mat leave) please investigate what the hell is going on with Miku baby monitors? First they said they‚Äôre going out of business. Then they said they‚Äôd sold all our data and now they‚Äôre charging $10 per user per month. üö®

Popping out of maternity leave to tell you ‚ÄúBillion Dollar Heist‚Äù is now out on Apple TV and Amazon Prime.

Starring ‚Å¶@MishaGlenny‚Å© as narrator, ‚Å¶@symantec‚Å©‚Äôs Eric Chien, ‚Å¶@mikko‚Å© and yours truly. https://t.co/SwLPKgw1lz
You should be able to bookmark/save tweets in categories a la instagram. #smallask
A good look at the winding voyage NSO spyware takes via contractors and subcontractors.  https://t.co/JsiElwpIh2
It‚Äôs my birthday. Tell me something amazing you did at the (otherwise extremely boring) age of 41‚Ä¶
@Cledge7 : )
I‚Äôve been (mostly) off Twitter for the past five weeks. It‚Äôs much better off than on. Thanks for those who sent Blue Sky invites. I‚Äôve had my hands full but plan to take you up soon!
Everyone, I command you to read this ‚Å¶@DanBarryNYT‚Å© Father‚Äôs Day special about a stolen Picasso.  https://t.co/VgNFBdHAZu
Sorry to have to cancel my #RSAC2023 book signing today and to miss seeing so many friends and colleagues. I have a good excuse‚Ä¶ expecting a baby any minute now. See you next year. ‚ú®

It does appear our democracy will live or die based on this case.

It‚Äôs hard to overstate how wild it would be if this went the wrong way.‚Äù - Marina Jenkins, @DemRedistrict 

https://t.co/IHLSuwrk74

Goes offline for a few weeks. Thinks things can‚Äôt possibly get more dumb. Sees this:

‚ÄúFox News‚Äô Rachel Campos-Duffy: Why Save Earth When Afterlife Is Real?‚Äù https://t.co/ksg86chvzw

I‚Äôve been so worried about this. @Blockparty is the only thing that makes @Twitter usable.

Someone please send me an invite to that other thing.

Blockparty‚Äôs departure is likely to be the final straw for me. https://t.co/7tcAZnfbAd
Nothing has prepared me for the five year old ‚Äúwhy?‚Äù phase like cybersecurity journalism.

And then there were four. 

See you in many months while I do the hardest work of all: MOM-ing. https://t.co/Y9yWZkmoOL
I am proud to say I was one of those 180 letter writers. I‚Äôm relieved to hear reason finally prevailed in the government‚Äôs misguided case against Joe Sullivan. https://t.co/p0DoWmsRup
Biden urges GOP to act on assault weapons: Thoughts, prayers "are not enough" https://t.co/P7HcRdAXKH
My discussion with @auren on the future of cybersecurity was a good one‚Ä¶ https://t.co/EslII89oWn
In honor of Danny DeVito greeting fans at the Warriors-Lakers game last night, and prom season. https://t.co/1PdN8HzIrv

‚ÄúI‚Äôve been pursuing the same enemy for 25 years,‚Äù Skovronsky said.

Excellent article on a hero among us by one of the best ‚Å¶@matthewherper‚Å© 

 https://t.co/MxwgaOKeE5
I really miss ‚Å¶@carr2n‚Å© today. https://t.co/im69n8kiU1
Michael Bennett sounds incredibly sane, smart, level headed and‚Äîdare I say‚Äîpresidential here. https://t.co/epAF1TYQwP
@Rogntuudju Not dumb, but assumes his constituents are.

No bueno. 

The same initial supply chain attack launched by North Korean hackers against 3CX also affected two critical energy orgs in the United States and Europe.

H/t ‚Å¶@symantec‚Å©  https://t.co/C3R1EjP0Jx
CISA adds printer bug (my personal favorite), Chrome zero-day and ChatGPT issue to exploited vulnerabilities catalog https://t.co/bJK4HK9RIs
Omg. Brooks should get ejected.

I didn‚Äôt care to comment on this news cycle because, let‚Äôs be honest, this is @elonmusk‚Äôs revenge play on news orgs he doesn‚Äôt like. But wow‚Ä¶ He removed @RT_com‚Äôs ‚Äúgovernment funded media‚Äù label. Here is RT‚Äôs editor and chief thanking him. 

Overdue for intervention. https://t.co/8BspLCDdZP

A decade ago, we didn‚Äôt think North Korea was capable of much more than rudimentary phishing emails. Then came Sony. Then WannaCry. Then the shift towards crypto. Now they‚Äôre pulling off software supply chain attacks. ü•¥ https://t.co/yjyFFbUbsm

Another one, not getting national coverage: A 5 year old was shot and killed by a stray bullet in a car on her way to a birthday party. 

America 2023. https://t.co/tlM8bALk7H
Ted Lasso in my home country might be the best thing to happen in 2023. üá≥üá± #gezellig

In case you‚Äôre feeling particularly down and out tonight, I recommend reading all the words of support on Ralph Yarl‚Äôs GoFundMe page. It reminds me there are more good people in this country than bad. More love than hateful, ignorant, trigger happy idiots. https://t.co/E3ohTBgXIL

Dominion created a blueprint. It exposed the alternate reality Fox sells viewers. That @TuckerCarlson thinks Trump is ‚Äúdemonic.‚Äù That they knew Sidney Powell is a psycho.

This was never about press freedom; it was about Fox‚Äôs lies. $788M is just a start. https://t.co/6IaVjfp7k3

Looks like Bob Lee knew his alleged killer, was driving with him just before the stabbing, and this was neither random nor a robbery.

Doesn‚Äôt diminish the tragedy of Lee‚Äôs loss but certainly absolves San Francisco from being the cause.  https://t.co/LAOHZ7Vhqa

If you could know the full details of any hack of the last five years, which would you choose?

Mine would be the SFO WIFI incident that appeared to have been an attempt to breach one strategic passenger traveling that day.

Citizen Lab uncovers a new ‚Äúzero click‚Äù attack targeting journalists and political figures. This time from Israeli spyware company QuaDream. 

It works by sending targets iCloud calendar invites for events that occurred in the past (and thus invisible). https://t.co/BxaH4Pd1ip

‚ÄúAmericans now see cyberattack as the greatest threat facing the country, two recent polls show, suggesting that cyber fears have outflanked concern over climate change, immigration, terrorism or nuclear weapons.‚Äù https://t.co/3KYML9ujvZ
@StartupDreams @JohnsonThought1 @elonmusk @NPR @NPRKelly They absolutely do not.

This reads like a map. https://t.co/1J8r15kBJz

That was an incredibly hard to watch segment between @DanCrenshawTX and @DanaBashCNN on State of the Union. Crenshaw‚Äôs *only* solution for gun violence was‚Ä¶ adding armed guards (exactly what failed to save lives in Uvalde and Parkland). 

Vote them all out. #EnoughIsEnough
@vyodaiken @DanCrenshawTX Agree there should have been far more pushback. But to her credit, her ghost-white face also spoke volumes.

The lovely guys at https://t.co/yKLbw05BmX convinced me with a 12:01 email that they‚Äôd partnered with a new ü©∏ auth service and I got really excited. Bots don‚Äôt have blood! Mwuhaha! before I realized APRIL FOOLS.

And this is my sign to start mat leave. See you on the other side!
What‚Äôs going to happen to @blockpartyapp_ ? The only way to use Twitter imho. @triketora?

A blue check is not something I ever asked for, or wanted, and became a magnet for Twitter harassment. 

So, see ya blue check. Don‚Äôt let the door hit ya on the way out.
North Korean cyberhackers step up phishing attacks, target experts - The Washington Post https://t.co/JcPDDr6u3k

I don‚Äôt know how @RepOgles got voted in. I don‚Äôt know how any sane person voted for someone who would post this. But @RepOgles needs to be recalled, voted out, or‚Äî at minimum‚Äî flagged for CPS. https://t.co/zir37dd2gu

If you‚Äôre feeling helpless like me, one thing you can do is support Judge Jane Protasiewicz in next week‚Äôs Wisconsin Supreme Court election. The NRA candidate, Dan Kelly, fundraised at a gun range after the Molson Coors shooting. It‚Äôs a 10 year position. https://t.co/ScRLaVTved
@TMNYCA Unfortunately the reporter would probably get fired for that. üòû

If a woman is in her third trimester and happens to mention how exhausted she is, the absolute worst reply is: ‚ÄúJust wait until the baby comes.‚Äù

It‚Äôs not even true. Postpartum is a different type of exhaustion. Third tri is a physical, chemical slog fest of epic proportions.
@bozo777 Sweet 16. March Madness. Pretty amazing Cinderella story actually. They beat the 2 seed Arizona, then Mizzou but lost to Creighton tonight.

Yesterday, Jesus Ivan Cruz came to our house to fix our septic in this storm. On his way home, an uprooted tree smashed into his truck and killed him. He was only 29. Please consider donating to cover his funeral expenses and beyond. We are heartbroken.
 https://t.co/wVRKzHjfKx
@TMNYCA Thank you so much. Such a freak tragedy. We are so sad for him and his family.

@bicker_bob @lawrancecohen @KatzOnEarth Put another way, I don‚Äôt actually have any constructive ideas so I‚Äôll just call everyone bad and keep repeating myself on Twitter.

Also, shh, don‚Äôt tell anyone, but we live in a capitalist society. VC is how novel therapeutics, advanced chemotherapy, clean energy, cybersecurity, and innovations in data storage are backed.

@bicker_bob @lawrancecohen @KatzOnEarth A bad-faith ‚Äúsir‚Äù bit, you say? 

I recommend you take the time it took you to compose that tweet and do a Google search for how solar, Mandiant, Crowdstrike, novel therapeutics for macular degeneration and other diseases got funding and you will find your answer. https://t.co/Nt0Tl3jBw8

This can‚Äôt be our new normal. Schools are a frequent target. And there is a lot to learn (and avoid!) from the district‚Äôs dribbled response here: https://t.co/iRjpIEd6Sz
